publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2617 Robin Harper: Japan and Commercial Whaling—That the Parliament calls on the Scottish Executive to request that Her Majesty’s Government convey to the Japanese Government in the strongest terms its opposition to a return to full-scale commercial whaling and to request that the Japanese Government answers the allegation, made in a report by Greenpeace, that it is using development aid to buy votes in favour of a return to full-scale commercial whaling from small nation states within the International Whaling Commission. R
S1M-2617 Japan and Commercial Whaling (lodged on 16 January 2002) Michael Russell*, Donald Gorrie*

S1M-2617 Robin Harper: Japan and Commercial Whaling-That the Parliament calls on the Scottish Executive to request that Her Majesty's Government convey to the Japanese Government in the strongest terms its opposition to a return to full-scale commercial whaling and to request that the Japanese Government answers the allegation, made in a report by Greenpeace, that it is using development aid to buy votes in favour of a return to full-scale commercial whaling from small nation states within the International Whaling Commission. R Supported by: Michael Russell, Donald Gorrie, Cathy Peattie*
S1M-2617 Japan and Commercial Whaling (lodged on 16 January 2002) Mr Andrew Welsh*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Keith Raffan*
S1M-2617 Japan and Commercial Whaling (lodged on 16 January 2002) Christine Grahame*, Shona Robison*
S1M-2617 Japan and Commercial Whaling (lodged on 16 January 2002) Mr John McAllion*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-2617 Japan and Commercial Whaling (lodged on 16 January 2002) Fiona McLeod*, Alasdair Morgan*, Trish Godman*
S1M-2617 Japan and Commercial Whaling (lodged on 16 January 2002) Maureen Macmillan*
S1M-2617 Japan and Commercial Whaling (lodged on 16 January 2002) Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-2617 Japan and Commercial Whaling (lodged on 16 January 2002) Richard Lochhead*, Pauline McNeill*
S1M-2617 Japan and Commercial Whaling (lodged on 16 January 2002) Mr Duncan Hamilton*
